src/core/components/ai/playfight/PsyanimPlayfightFSM.js
PsyanimPlayfightFSM
description:
`PsyanimPlayfightFSM` implements the `Playfight v2` algorithm.

 Members marked with the `[advanced]` tag typically don't need to be modified. Although they can be modified, doing so can require tuning of several other parameters.

name: target
description: Required field specifies the target entity this agent will playfight with.

name: breakDurationAverage
description:
[Range: 500 - 50000 ]
 [Default: 2000 ]
 Average time, in milliseconds, the agents will wander before attacking target again.

name: breakDurationVariance
description:
[Range: 500 - 50000 ]
 [Default: 1000 ]
 Allowed variance in break duration.

name: minWanderDuration
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 50 - 50000 ]
 [Default: 150 ]
 Minimum time, in milliseconds, the agent must remain in wander state before it can transition out.

name: minTargetDistanceForCharge
description:
[Range: 50 - 1000 ]
 [Default: 200 ]
 Minimum distance from target from which this agent will initiate a charge.

name: maxTargetDistanceForCharge
description:
[Range: 200 - 1000 ]
 [Default: 500 ]
 Maximum distance from target which this agent will initiate a charge.

name: wanderFleeOrChargeWhenAttacked
description:
[Range: true/false ]
 [Default: true ]
 Controls whether the agent can flee or charge from wander state if attacked.

name: wanderPanicDistance
description:
[Range: 200 - 1000 ]
 [Default: 250 ]
 Distance from attacker which this agent will transition to flee or charge delay state, if allowed.

name: wanderFleeRate
description:
[Range: 0.0 - 1.0 ]
 [Default: 0.5 ]
 Probability that agent will flee vs. charge when attacker is within panicDistance.

name: averageChargeDelay
description:
[Range: 500 - 50000 ]
 [Default: 600 ]
 Average time, in milliseconds, the agents will wander before charging.

name: chargeDelayVariance
description:
[Range: 50 - 50000 ]
 [Default: 400 ]
 Allowed variance in charge delay.

name: wanderSensorRadiusPadding
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Default: 75 ]

name: maxFleeDuration
description:
[Range: 500 - 50000 ]
 [Default: 500 ]
 Maximum time this agent can remain in flee state since entering.

name: maxChargeDuration
description:
[Range: 500 - 50000 ]
 [Default: 1500 ]
 Maximum time the agent can stay in charge state.

name: maxChargeSpeed
description:
[Range: 3 - 20 ]
 [Default: 9 ]
 Maximum speed at which this agent can charge at it's target.

name: maxChargeAcceleration
description:
[Range: 0.05 - 0.7 ]
 [Default: 0.4 ]
 Maximum acceleration this agent can reach when charging at it's target.

name: innerDecelerationRadius
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 5 - 500 ]
 [Default: 12 ]
 Distance, in px, from target which the agent will come to rest.

name: outerDecelerationRadius
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 5 - 500 ]
 [Default: 30 ]
 Distance, in px, from target which the agent will begin slowing down.

name: maxWanderSpeed
description:
[Range: 3 - 20 ]
 [Default: 4 ]
 Maximum speed at which the agent will wander.

name: maxWanderAcceleration
description:
[Range: 0.05 - 0.7 ]
 [Default: 0.2 ]
 Maximum acceleration the agent can attain during wander.

name: wanderRadius
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 5 - 500 ]
 [Default: 50 ]
 Radius of the wander circle.

name: wanderOffset
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 5 - 500 ]
 [Default: 250 ]
 Distance the wander circle is offset from the agent's position.

name: maxWanderAngleChangePerFrame
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 3 - 360 ]
 [Default: 20 ]
 Maximum number of degrees the wander target can move around the wander circle per frame.

name: maxFleeSpeed
description:
[Range: 3 - 20 ]
 [Default: 12 ]
 Maximum speed this agent can flee from the target.

name: maxFleeAcceleration
description:
[Range: 0.05 - 0.7 ]
 [Default: 0.5 ]
 Maximum acceleration this agent can reach during flee from target.

name: fleePanicDistance
description:
[Range: - ]
 [Default: ]

name: src/core/components/ai/playfight/PsyanimPlayfightHFSM.js
src/core/components/ai/playfight/PsyanimPlayfightSeparationFSM.js
src/core/components/ai/playfight/PsyanimPlayfightSeparationState.js

src/core/components/ai/predatorprey/PsyanimPredatorChargeState.js
src/core/components/ai/predatorprey/PsyanimPredatorFSM.js
PsyanimPredatorFSM
description:
`PsyanimPredatorFSM` implements the `Predator v2` algorithm.

 Members marked with the `[advanced]` tag typically don't need to be modified. Although they can be modified, doing so can require tuning of several other parameters.

name: target
description: Agent which this predator will watch and pursue.

name: subtlety
description:
[Range: 0 - 180]
 [Default: 30]
 Maximum number of degrees which this agent will offset its chase direction.

name: subtletyLag
description:
[Range: 0 - 1000 ]
 [Default: 500 ]
 Determines how often the agent will recompute its chase direction offset based on the `subtlety` parameter.

name: averageWanderDuration
description:
[Range:  1000 - 10000 ]
 [Default: 2000 ]
 Amount of time, in millseconds, this agent will wander before attempting another charge.

name: wanderDurationVariance
description:
[Range: 0 - 10000 ]
 [Default: 500 ]
 Variance in wander duration, which gets recomputed each time agent enters wander state.

name: maxWanderSpeed
description:
[Range: 0.5 - 10.0 ]
 [Default: 3 ]
 Maximum speed at which the agent will wander.

name: maxWanderAcceleration
description:
[Range: 0.05 - 0.4 ]
 [Default: 0.2]
 Maximum acceleration the agent can attain during wander.

name: wanderRadius
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 25 - 200 ]
 [Default: 50 ]
 Radius of the wander circle.

name: wanderOffset
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 75 - 500 ]
 [Default: 250 ]
 Distance the wander circle is offset from the agent's position.

name: maxWanderAngleChangePerFrame
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 5 - 90 ]
 [Default: 10 ]
 Maximum number of degrees the wander target can move around the wander circle per frame.

name: averageChargeDuration
description:
[Range: 1000 - 10000 ]
 [Default: 2000 ]
 Average time which the agent will remain in a charge state.

name: chargeDurationVariance
description:
[Range: 0 - 10000 ]
 [Default: 500 ]
 Variance in charge duration, which is recomputed every time agent enters charge state.

name: maxChargeSpeed
description:
[Range: 1.5 - 10.0 ]
 [Default: 3 ]
 Maximum speed agent can reach during charge.

name: maxChargeAcceleration
description:
[Range: 0.05 - 0.4 ]
 [Default: 0.2 ]
 Maximum acceleration agent can attain during a charge.

name: innerDecelerationRadius
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 0 - 100 ]
 [Default: 12 ]
 Inner deceleration radius of 'Arrive behavior' used during charge.

name: outerDecelerationRadius
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 100 - 300 ]
 [Default: 30 ]
 Outer deceleration radius of 'Arrive behavior' used during charge.

name: nSamplesForLookSmoothing
description:
[***advanced***]
Number of samples used for vehicle smoothing

name: src/core/components/ai/predatorprey/PsyanimPredatorWanderState.js
src/core/components/ai/predatorprey/PsyanimPreyFleeState.js
src/core/components/ai/predatorprey/PsyanimPreyFSM.js
PsyanimPreyFSM
description:
`PsyanimPreyFSM` implements the `Prey v2` algorithm.

 Members marked with the `[advanced]` tag typically don't need to be modified. Although they can be modified, doing so can require tuning of several other parameters.

name: target
description: Agent which this prey will watch and avoid.

name: subtlety
description:
[Range: 0 - 180 ]
 [Default: 30 ]
 Maximum number of degrees which this agent will offset it's flee direction.

name: subtletyLag
description:
[Range: 0 - 10000 ]
 [Default: 500 ]
 Determines how often the agent will recompute it's flee direction based on the `subtlety` parameter.

name: maxWanderSpeed
description:
[Range: 0.5 - 10.0 ]
 [Default: 3 ]
 Maximum speed at which the agent will wander.

name: maxWanderAcceleration
description:
[Range: 0.05 - 0.4 ]
 [Default: 0.2 ]
 Maximum acceleration the agent can attain during wander.

name: wanderRadius
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 25 - 200 ]
 [Default: 50 ]
 Radius of the wander circle.

name: wanderOffset
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 75 - 500 ]
 [Default: 250 ]
 Distance the wander circle is offset from the agent's position.

name: maxWanderAngleChangePerFrame
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 5 - 90 ]
 [Default: 20 ]
 Maximum number of degrees the wander target can move around the wander circle per frame.

name: panicDistance
description:
[Range: 50 - 600 ]
 [Default: 250 ]
 Min. distance, in 'px', to target in which this agent will flee to maintain.

name: maxFleeSpeed
description:
[Range: 0.5 - 10.0 ]
 [Default: 3 ]
 Max. speed agent can travel at when fleeing from target agent

name: maxFleeAcceleration
description:
[Range: 0.05 - 4.0 ]
 [Default: 0.2 ]
 Max. rate at which agent can accelerate when fleeing from target agent

name: minimumWallSeparation
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 25 - 200 ]
 [Default: 50 ]
 Minimum distance from all screen boundaries required for this agent to remain in 'Flee' state.

 If distance to any screen boundary is less than this distance, agent will transition to wall avoidance.

name: wallAvoidanceSubtlety
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 5 - 90]
 [Default: 10]
 Maximum number of degrees which this agent will offset it's flee direction during wall avoidance.

name: wallAvoidanceSubtletyLag
description:
[***advanced***]
 [Range: 0 - 10000 ]
 [Default: 1000 ]
 Determines how often the agent will recompute it's flee direction based on the `wallAvoidanceSubtlety` parameter.

name: seekTargetLocations
description:
[***advanced***]
 List of points in the world where agent can seek away from wall before returning to a wander state.

name: seekTargetStoppingDistance
description:
[***advanced***]
 Distance from current seek target before agent is considered to have reached it 
 and transitions back to wander state.

name: nSamplesForLookSmoothing
description:
[***advanced***]
Number of samples used for vehicle smoothing

name: src/core/components/ai/predatorprey/PsyanimPreyWallAvoidanceState.js
src/core/components/ai/predatorprey/PsyanimPreyWanderState.js
src/core/components/ai/PsyanimBasicHFSM.js
PsyanimBasicHFSM
description:
`PsyanimBasicHFSM` is a variant of a hierarchical state machine which allows building a state machine
 that's composed of other state machines, with a stack-based mechanism for interrupting a state machine
 to begin execution of another, or to resume execution of a previously running machine from same state.

name: initialSubStateMachine
description: Initial state machine to execute on start

name: debugLogging
description: Enabled debug logging in console

name: debugGraphics
description: Enabled debug visualization in phaser canvas

name: events
description: Event emitter for all PsyanimBasicHFSM events

name: currentFSMName
description: The name of the currently executing PsyanimFSM instance.

name: currentStateName
description: Returns the name of the current state for the currently executing PsyanimFSM instance.

name: getStateVariableSnapshot
description: Returns a snapshot of the current state variables for all sub-state machines in the HFSM.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - object containing the state variables as key-value pairs.

return.description: object containing the state variables as key-value pairs.

name: stringifyStateVariables
description: Returns a JSON object containing this HFSM's state variables

unknown.tagValue: {string} - a stringified version of this HFSM's state variables

return.description: a stringified version of this HFSM's state variables

name: getCurrentSubStateMachine
description: Returns a reference to the currently executing sub-state machine

unknown.tagValue: {PsyanimFSM} - object of type that inherits from PsyanimFSM

return.description: object of type that inherits from PsyanimFSM

name: getSubStateMachine
description: Gets a reference to sub-state machine of type `fsmType`

params.name: fsmType
params.description: type that inherits from `PsyanimFSM`

name: hasSubStateMachine
description: Returns true if this HFSM is composed of an FSM of type `fsmType`

params.name: fsmType
params.description: type that inherits from `PsyanimFSM`

name: addSubStateMachine
description: Adds a sub-state machine to this HFSM.

params.name: fsm
params.description: instance of a type that inherits from `PsyanimFSM`

name: addInterrupt
description: Sets up interrupt to either 1) transition from `sourceFSMType` to `destinationFSMType` or 2) pop running `sourceFSMType` off the stack.

params.name: sourceFSMType
params.description: instance of a type that inherits from `PsyanimFSM`

params.name: variableKey
params.description: name of variable key to be checked in the `condition` function

params.name: condition
params.description: function that accepts the value of `variableKey` variable and returns true or false

params.name: destinationFSMType
params.description: instance of a type that inherits from `PsyanimFSM`. If null, `sourceFSMType` gets popped off stack on transition.

name: afterCreate
description: If overriden, must call super.afterCreate() in child class.

name: update
description: If overriden, super.update(t, dt) must be called in child class update().

name: src/core/components/ai/PsyanimBasicHFSMInterrupt.js
PsyanimBasicHFSMInterrupt
description: `PsyanimBasicHFSMInterrupt` encapsulates information related to an interrupt.

name: sourceFSM
description: The FSM which triggers the interrupt condition.

name: destinationFSM
description: The FSM which the HFSM will transition to, pushing it onto the execution stack. If null, the interrupt results in `sourceFSM` being popped off stack.

name: isTriggered
description: Returns `true` if the interrupt condition is satisfied at runtime.

name: src/core/components/ai/PsyanimFSM.js
PsyanimFSM
description:
`PsyanimFSM` is the main finite-state machine class for the Psyanim Decision-Making framework.
 
 At any time, execution of this state machine may be resumed, paused, stopped and restarted programmatically.

name: initialState
description: The initial state of the FSM is the first state the FSM will enter() on start.

name: debugLogging
description: If true, this FSM will run in debug mode.

name: events
description: Event emitter for this FSM.

name: currentStateName
description: The name of the currently executing state.

name: getStateVariableSnapshot
description: Returns a snapshot of the current state variables for this FSM.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - object containing state variables as key-value pairs

return.description: object containing state variables as key-value pairs

name: stringifyStateVariables
description: Returns a JSON object containing this FSM's state variables

unknown.tagValue: {string} - a stringified version of this FSM's state variable object

return.description: a stringified version of this FSM's state variable object

name: getState
description: Returns a reference to the state of type 'stateType' or null if not found

params.name: stateType
params.description: a state type that inherits from PsyanimFSMState

name: hasState
description: Returns `true` if this state machine is composed of `stateType`

params.name: stateType
params.description: a state type that inherits from PsyanimFSMState

name: addState
description: This method creates a new state of type `stateType` within this state machine.

unknown.tagValue: a reference to the newly created state instance

params.name: stateType
params.description: a state type that inherits from PsyanimFSMState

return.description: a reference to the newly created state instance

name: currentState
description: A reference to the state that is currently executing.

name: afterCreate
description: If overriden, must call super.afterCreate() in child class.

name: stateVariableExists
description: Checks if a state variable is defined for this state machine

unknown.tagValue: `true` if the variable is defined for this state machine

return.description: `true` if the variable is defined for this state machine

name: setStateVariable
description: Sets the value of a state variable for this state machine.

name: getStateVariable
description: Gets the value of a state variable for this state machine.

unknown.tagValue: {*} - the value of the state variable for `key`

return.description: the value of the state variable for `key`

name: pause
description: Pauses the execution of this state machine, w/o resetting it's state (can be resumed in same state).

name: stop
description:
Stops the execution of this state machine.

Current state is reset to initial state.

name: restart
description: Stops the execution of this state machine before resuming from initial state.

name: resume
description: Resumes the execution of this state machine.

name: onPause
description: This method is called when this FSM is paused. Child classes may override to add custom logic, but must call `super.onPause()`

name: onStop
description: This method is called when this FSM is stopped. Child classes may override to add custom logic, but must call `super.onStop()`

name: onResume
description: This method is called when this FSM is resumed. Child classes may override to add custom logic, but must call `super.onResume()`

name: update
description: If overriden, super.update(t, dt) must be called in child class update().

name: src/core/components/ai/PsyanimFSMState.js
PsyanimFSMState
description: `PsyanimFSMState` represents a single state in a `PsyanimFSM` state machine.

name: name
description: The name of the state. Same as class name.

name: fsm
description: Reference to the state machine this state belongs to.

name: entity
description: Reference to the entity this state's FSM is attached to.

name: stage
description: The stage of execution this state is currently in.

name: transitions
description: List of transitions that can be triggered while FSM is in this state.

name: isActive
description: Returns `true` if this state is currently running.

name: getTransition
description: Gets reference to state transition object by target state type and variable key.

params.name: targetStateType
params.description: must be a class that inherits from `PsyanimFSMState`

name: hasTransition
description: Returns true if state has transition defined by target state type and variable key.

params.name: targetStateType
params.description: must be a class that inherits from `PsyanimFSMState`

name: addTransition
description: Adds a transition to this state.

params.name: targetStateType
params.description: must be a class that inherits from `PsyanimFSMState`

name: afterCreate
description: If overriden, must call super.afterCreate() in child class.

name: enter
description: Called to notify state that it's been activated within the PsyanimFSM state machine. Intended to be overriden by child class, but must call super.enter()!

name: exit
description: Called to notify state that it's been exited within the PsyanimFSM state machine. Intended to be overriden by child class, but must call super.exit()!

name: onPause
description: This method is called when the FSM is paused. Child classes may override to add custom logic, but must call `super.onPause()`

name: onStop
description: This method is called when the FSM is stopped. Child classes may override to add custom logic, but must call `super.onStop()`

name: onResume
description: This method is called when the FSM is resumed. Child classes may override to add custom logic, but must call `super.onResume()`

name: run
description: This method is called by the parent FSM and is intended to be overriden by child classes, but don't forget to call `super.run()`

name: src/core/components/ai/PsyanimFSMStateTransition.js
PsyanimFSMStateTransition
description: `PsyanimFSMStateTransition` encapsulates information necessary for a state transition within a PsyanimFSM.

name: targetStateType
description: Reference to target state for this transition.

name: variableKey
description: Variable key for the transition variable used in transition condition.

name: isTriggered
description: `true` if transition condition is met during FSM execution.

name: src/core/components/animation/PsyanimMimic.js
PsyanimMimic
description:
`PsyanimMimic` component allows an entity to 'mimic' the behavior of `target` entity.

 For a 'Predator-Prey-Mimic' scene, we should set the prey's 'color' to white so it is invisible on the canvas.  We should also set the 'depth' field of the entity's shapeParams to '0' for the prey, and '1' for the mimic.  This ensures the mimic is always drawn on top of the prey in the canvas., since they can overlap.

name: target
description: Target entity to mimic.

name: angleOffset
description:
[Range: 0 - 360 ]
 [Default: 30 ]
 Angle, in degrees, by which to rotate all of the target's displacements before applying them
 to this entity.

name: src/core/components/controllers/PsyanimClickToMove.js
PsyanimClickToMove
description: `PsyanimClickToMove` gives agents the ability to move to location under cursor in response to mouse click on canvas.

name: grid
description: Reference to the navigation grid required for pathfinding to new location.

name: pathfinder
description: Reference to pathfinder used to find walkable routes to target locations.

name: arriveAgent
description: Reference to the arrive agent used for locomotion.

name: state
description: The state of the click-to-move controller.

name: cancelMovementRequest
description: Cancels the current movement request that was triggered by the last mouse-click on a valid navgrid location.

name: src/core/components/controllers/PsyanimClickToMoveBasic.js
PsyanimClickToMoveBasic
description:
Simple click-to-move controller that moves in a straight line to clicked location on canvas.

 This class makes no attempt to navigate around obstacles.  For a canvas with obstacles, 
 use `PsyanimClickToMove` with a pathfinder on a navigation grid.

name: arriveAgent
description: Sets the arrive agent this controller uses for locomotion.

name: src/core/components/controllers/PsyanimMouseFollowTarget.js
PsyanimMouseFollowTarget
description: This controller creates a visible target in the scene which follows the mouse cursor.

name: src/core/components/controllers/PsyanimPhysicsSettingsController.js
PsyanimPhysicsSettingsController
description:
This controller allows the user to slow down the rate at which simulation time passes by pressing the 't' key. Mostly for debugging.

 Pressing 't' toggles the rate of time passage between the `slowTimeScale` and normal time (1.0).

name: slowTimeScale
description: Fraction of normal time that this controller will slow the rate of simulation time passage to.

name: src/core/components/controllers/PsyanimPlayerController.js
PsyanimPlayerController
description:
The `PsyanimPlayerController` provides a `WASD keyboard controller` for controlling any entity in a `PsyanimScene`.

If used with a `PsyanimClickToMove` controller, WASD inputs will interrupt click-to-move traversal path-following.

name: speed
description: Speed at which the entity moves in response to WASD keyboard input.

name: turnSpeed
description: Speed at which the entity rotates when changing directions.

name: clickToMoveController
description: An (optional) reference to a PsyanimClickToMove component that this controller can work in conjunction with.

name: src/core/components/controllers/PsyanimSceneController.js
PsyanimSceneChangeController
description:
This class is used specifically for changing scenes only in the `psyanim-2` test suite.

 Should not be used in production.

subtlety
description:
Basic algorithm is to wander until a target is in sight, and then pursue that target, but
 more subtly by varying the pursuit angle a tad bit off from the normal direction an 
 'arrive' behavior would approach at.

src/core/prefabs/PsyanimAdvancedFleeAgentPrefab.js
src/core/prefabs/PsyanimAdvancedPlayfightAgentPrefab.js
PsyanimAdvancedPlayfightAgentPrefab
description:
Prefab for creating `Advanced Playfight Agents`.

 The `Advanced Playfight Agent` is a variant of the `Playfight Agent` which provides a more precisely
 timed charge allowing us to keep frequency of collisions roughly constant throughout the playfight.

 An `Advanced Playfight Agent` has the following components:

 `PsyanimVehicle`, `PsyanimPreciselyTimedArriveBehavior`, `PsyanimAdvancedFleeBehavior`, `PsyanimSeekBehavior`, 
 `PsyanimWanderBehavior`, `PsyanimAdvancedPlayfightBehavior`, `PsyanimAdvancedPlayfightAgent`

name: breakDuration
description: The break duration determines how long, in milliseconds, the agent wanders before attacking its target again.

name: collisionFrequency
description:
Collision frequency determines how often, in milliseconds, the agent should attack it's target. `Collision frequency` = `break duration` + `charge duration`

 Note that this should be longer than the break duration so that the `break duration` + `charge duration` is always less than `collision frequency`.

name: maxChargeSpeed
description: Maximum speed the agent can reach while charging towards target.

name: maxWanderSpeed
description: Maximum speed at which the agent will wander.

name: maxWanderAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration the agent can attain during wander.

name: wanderRadius
description: Radius of the wander circle.

name: wanderOffset
description: Distance the wander circle is offset from the agent's position.

name: maxWanderAngleChangePerFrame
description: Maximum number of degrees the wander target can move around the wander circle per frame.

name: maxFleeSpeed
description: Maximum speed this agent can flee from the target.

name: maxFleeAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration this agent can reach during flee from target.

name: panicDistance
description: Distance from target at which the agent will begin fleeing.

name: maxChargeAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration the agent can attain during a charge.

name: innerDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which the agent will come to rest.

name: outerDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which the agent will begin slowing down.

name: src/core/prefabs/PsyanimArriveAgentPrefab.js
PsyanimArriveAgentPrefab
description:
Prefab for creating `Arrive Agents`.

 An `Arrive Agent` seeks the target, slowing down before reaching it, eventually coming to rest.

 An `Arrive Agent` has the following components: 

 `PsyanimVehicle`, `PsyanimArriveBehavior`, `PsyanimArriveAgent`

name: maxSpeed
description: Maximum speed this entity's vehicle can travel.

name: innerDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which agent will come to rest.

name: outerDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which the agent will begin slowing down.

name: src/core/prefabs/PsyanimClickToMovePlayerPrefab.js

src/core/prefabs/PsyanimPlayfightAgentPrefab.js
PsyanimPlayfightAgentPrefab
description:
Prefab for creating `Playfight Agents`.

 A `Playfight Agent` is an agent that simulates the playfighting behavior of two animals.

 It wanders about the world randomly, and at specified intervals, attacks another agent by charging 
 at it until they make contact, at which point it returns to wandering until the next time to attack.

 A `Playfight Agent` has the following components:

 `PsyanimVehicle`, `PsyanimArriveBehavior`, `PsyanimAdvancedFleeBehavior`, `PsyanimSeekBehavior`, `PsyanimWanderBehavior`,
 `PsyanimPlayfightBehavior`, `PsyanimPlayfightAgent`

name: breakDuration
description: The break duration determines how long, in milliseconds, the agent wanders before attacking its target again.

name: maxChargeSpeed
description: Maximum speed at which this agent can charge at it's target.

name: maxChargeAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration this agent can reach when charging at it's target.

name: innerDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which the agent will come to rest.

name: outerDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which the agent will begin slowing down.

name: maxWanderSpeed
description: Maximum speed at which the agent will wander.

name: maxWanderAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration the agent can attain during wander.

name: wanderRadius
description: Radius of the wander circle.

name: wanderOffset
description: Distance the wander circle is offset from the agent's position.

name: maxWanderAngleChangePerFrame
description: Maximum number of degrees the wander target can move around the wander circle per frame.

name: maxFleeSpeed
description: Maximum speed this agent can flee from the target.

name: maxFleeAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration this agent can reach during flee from target.

name: panicDistance
description: Distance from target at which the agent will begin fleeing.

name: debug
description: Enables debug output for this agent's Playfight Behavior.

name: src/core/prefabs/PsyanimPreciselyTimedArriveAgentPrefab.js
src/core/prefabs/PsyanimPredatorPrefab.js
PsyanimPredatorPrefab
description:
Prefab for creating a `Predator Agent`.

 A `Predator Agent` will wander until the target comes within its field-of-view and remains within the `boredom distance`,
 at which point it will begin to chase the target in a direction offset by the `subtlety` parameter.

 A `Predator Agent` has the following components: 

 `PsyanimVehicle`, `PsyanimArriveBehavior`, `PsyanimSeekBehavior`, `PsyanimWanderBehavior`, 
 `PsyanimFOVSensor`, `PsyanimBasicPredatorBehavior`, `PsyanimPredatorAgent`

name: subtlety
description: Maximum number of degrees which this agent will offset its chase direction.

name: subtletyLag
description: Determines how often the agent will recompute its chase direction offset based on the `subtlety` parameter.

name: boredomDistance
description: Max. distance, in 'px', to target beyond which this predator will no longer chase it

name: showDebugLogs
description: If true, agent state transitions will be written out to Psyanim Debug Logs

name: showDebugGraphics
description: Toggles debug graphics for field-of-view.

name: minimumWanderTime
description:
The minimum amount of time the agent must wander before it can transition to pursuing the target.

 This is helpful for interactive scenes where we don't want the agent constantly pursuing a target.

name: useFov
description:
Determines how whether or not this agent will have a limited field of view.

 If false, the agent's field of view will be 360 degrees and have unlimited range.

name: fovAngle
description: Field-of-view cone angle, in degrees.

name: fovResolution
description:
Field-of-view resolution, in degrees.  

 This determines how many degrees of the field-of-view an entity must occupy to be detected.

 The lower the number, the higher the resolution, and the more CPU overhead this component has.

name: maxChaseSpeed
description: Maximum speed at which this agent will chase the target.

name: maxChaseAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration at which this agent will reach during a chase.

name: chaseInnerDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which agent will come to rest during a chase.

name: chaseOuterDecelerationRadius
description: Distance, in px, from target which the agent will begin slowing down during a chase.

name: wanderRadius
description: Radius of the wander circle

name: wanderOffset
description: Distance the wander circle is offset from the agent's position.

name: maxWanderAngleChangePerFrame
description: Maximum number of degrees the wander target can move around the wander circle per frame.

name: maxWanderSpeed
description: Maximum speed at which the agent can wander.

name: maxWanderAcceleration
description: Maximum rate at which the agent can accelerate when wandering.

name: src/core/prefabs/PsyanimPreyPrefab.js
PsyanimPreyPrefab
description:
Prefab for creating a `Prey Agent`.

 A `Prey Agent` will wander until the target comes within its field-of-view and within the `panic distance`,
 at which point it will begin to flee from the target in a direction offset by the `subtlety` parameter.

 A `Prey Agent` has the following components: 

 `PsyanimVehicle`, `PsyanimFleeBehavior`, `PsyanimSeekBehavior`, `PsyanimWanderBehavior`, 
 `PsyanimFOVSensor`, `PsyanimBasicPreyBehavior`, `PsyanimPreyAgent`

name: subtlety
description: Maximum number of degrees which this agent will offset it's flee direction.

name: subtletyLag
description: Determines how often the agent will recompute it's flee direction based on the `subtlety` parameter.

name: safetyDistance
description: Min. distance, in 'px', to target in which this predator will flee to maintain.

name: showDebugLogs
description: If true, agent state transitions will be written out to Psyanim Debug Logs

name: showDebugGraphics
description: Toggles debug graphics for obstacle avoidance multi-ray sensor and field-of-view.

name: maxFleeSpeed
description: Maximum speed this agent can flee from the target.

name: maxFleeAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration this agent can reach during flee from target.

name: panicDistance
description: Distance from target at which the agent will begin fleeing.

name: maxSeekSpeed
description: Max. speed the prey agent will seek away from screen boundaries

name: maxSeekAcceleration
description: Max. acceleration the prey agent will reach when seeking away from screen boundaries

name: mainRayLength
description: Length of the main ray used for collision detection with obstacles.

name: whiskerLength
description: Length of the 'whisker' rays used for collision detection with obstacles.

name: whiskerAngle
description: Angle of the 'whisker' rays with respect to the prey agent's forward direction

name: maxWanderSpeed
description: Maximum speed at which the agent will wander.

name: maxWanderAcceleration
description: Maximum acceleration the agent can attain during wander.

name: wanderRadius
description: Radius of the wander circle.

name: wanderOffset
description: Distance the wander circle is offset from the agent's position.

name: maxWanderAngleChangePerFrame
description: Maximum number of degrees the wander target can move around the wander circle per frame.

name: useFov
description:
Determines how whether or not this agent will have a limited field of view.

 If false, the agent's field of view will be 360 degrees and have unlimited range.

name: fovAngle
description: Field-of-view cone angle, in degrees.

name: fovRange
description: Field-of-view cone height, in pixels.  Determines how far out the agent can see.

name: fovResolution
description:
Field-of-view resolution, in degrees.  

 This determines how many degrees of the field-of-view an entity must occupy to be detected.

 The lower the number, the higher the resolution, and the more CPU overhead this component has.

src/core/PsyanimApp.js
PsyanimApp
description:
PsyanimApp is a Singleton class that encapsulates the entire real-time application for Psyanim2.

 PsyanimApp contains the Phaser.Game instance and manages the parent DOM element for the Phaser HTML5 canvas.

name: Instance
description: Application-wide Singleton Instance of PsyanimApp

name: events
description: Application-wide event emitter for PsyanimApp.

name: setCanvasVisible
description: Toggles canvas visibility by appending/removing HTML element to/from it's parent element in the document.body.

name: sessionID
description: The session ID for this app instance.  Guaranteed to be unique across all PsyanimApp instances.

name: currentScene
description: The current PsyanimScene that is running.

name: currentSceneKey
description: The scene key of the current scene that is running.

name: sceneKeys
description: All configured scene keys.

name: domElement
description: The parent element of the Phaser canvas.

name: config
description: The PsyanimConfig used for this PsyanimApp.Instance.

name: game
description: The Phaser.Game instance for this PsyanimApp.Instance.  This is `undefined` until you PsyanimApp.Instance.run() is called.

name: getSceneByKey
description: Returns the PsyanimScene associated with `sceneKey`

name: loadScene
description:
Load a particular scene by key.

NOTE: Scene must have been registered with PsyanimApp.Instance.config

params.name: sceneKey
params.description: key identifying a particular scene to be loaded.

name: stopCurrentScene
description: Stops the current scene from running.

name: currentPlayerID
description: Current player ID for this session.

name: currentPlayerID
description: Sets the current player ID for this session.

name: run
description: Starts PsyanimApp, creating a new Phaser.Game() and runs the first scene in `this.sceneKeys`.

name: src/core/PsyanimComponent.js
PsyanimComponent
description:
A `PsyanimComponent` is the most fundamental building block of `user-defined state` and `behavior` in Psyanim-2.

This class, `PsyanimComponent`, is designed to be inherited from and attached to `PsyanimEntities`.

name: entity
description: The entity to which this component is attached.

name: scene
description: The scene to which this component's entity belongs.

name: constructor
description: The constructor of the PsyanimComponent must be provided the PsyanimEntity instance to which it is attached.

name: destroy
description:
Called whenever the entity is destroyed.

This method is meant to be overriden in child class, but don't forget to call super.destroy().

name: enabled
description: This component's update() method only runs when it is enabled.

return.description: flag represents whether this component is enabled or not.

name: enabled
description:
Sets whether or not this component is enabled.

This component's update() method only runs when it is enabled.

params.description: flag represents whether to enable or disable this component

name: onEnable
description:
This method is called once every time a component is enabled.

This method is meant to be overriden in child class, but don't forget to call super.onEnable().

name: onDisable
description:
This method is called once every time a component is disabled.

This method is meant to be overriden in child class, but don't forget to call super.onDisable().

name: onSensorEnter
description:
onSensorEnter is called any time another entity enters this entity's sensor. This method is intended to be overriden in child class.

All sensors attached to an entity are treated as a single composite sensor.

params.name: entity
params.description: the entity that entered this entity's sensor.

name: onSensorExit
description:
onSensorExit is called any time another entity exits this entity's sensor. This method is intended to be overriden in child class.

All sensors attached to an entity are treated as a single composite sensor.

params.name: entity
params.description: the entity that exited this entity's sensor.

name: afterCreate
description:
This method is called once after a scene is created for each component instance.

It will run after the constructor(), but before the first time update() is called,
and guaranteed to only run after the `PsyanimScene`'s create() method has finished.

This method is meant to be overriden in child class, but don't forget to call super.afterCreate().

name: beforeShutdown
description: This method is called once after a scene load has been triggered, but before the current scene shuts down.

name: update
description: This method is run once every simulation frame.

params.name: t
params.description: current time in seconds, measured relative to app start

params.name: dt
params.description: time since last update() ran, in ms (frametime)

name: src/core/PsyanimConfig.js
PsyanimConfig
description: Application-wide configuration class for PsyanimApp

name: registerScene
description: Registers a scene so it is available to load at runtime (after `PsyanimApp.Instance.run()` is called).

params.name: scene
params.description: either a `PsyanimScene type` or a `Psyanim Scene Definition`

name: sceneKeys
description: The keys currently registered with this config object.

name: sceneDefinitions
description: A list of the `Psyanim scene definition`s currently registered with this config object.

name: getSceneDefinition
description: Returns the scene definition associated with `key`.

params.name: key
params.description: key that uniquely identifies a particular scene definition

name: setDebugEnabled
description: Enables / disables application-wide debug features, including Phaser's matter-js debug visualizations.

name: phaserConfig
description:
The underlying Phaser config object managed by this PsyanimConfig object.

 For full API docs of Phaser config object, see https://newdocs.phaser.io/docs/3.70.0/Phaser.Core.Config

name: src/core/PsyanimConstants.js
src/core/PsyanimDataDrivenScene.js
PsyanimDataDrivenScene
description:
Algorithm (order is important!):

     - Validate scene definition adheres to schema
     - Setup navgrid, if configured
     - Instantiate all non-prefab entities
     - Add all components to non-prefab entities
     - Configure all prefabs' value-type fields (non-entity or non-components fields)
     - Instantiate all prefab entities in the scene
     - Configure all entities' components

name: src/core/PsyanimEntity.js
PsyanimEntity
description:
Any object that exists in a scene, regardless of its visual representation, is called a `PsyanimEntity`.

 More technically, it's an abstraction for anything that exists in a `Psyanim Scene` with a particular location, rotation, and (optionally) a visual representation which can have physics applied to it.

 Entities may or may not have a visual representation in the scene.

 Moreover, entities alone do not have any logic or behaviors. While entities have no user-defined state, they do have a position, orientation and velocity in the world, and can have forces / accelerations applied to them.

 Any object in your simulation that needs a position or orientation, a visual representation in the scene, or needs to have physics applied to it, should be added to the scene as an entity.

 A `PsyanimEntity` acts a container for `PsyanimComponents`.

 All user-defined state and behaviors are encapsulated in PsyanimComponents, which are reusable scripts that can be attached to a PsyanimEntity and offer hooks into the real-time update loop of each scene.

 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 Some helpful tips:
     - use 'this.visible' to toggle sprite visibility
     - use 'this.body.isSleeping' to toggle whether or not this object receives physics updates
     - use 'this.body.isSensor' to toggle whether this body collides with other bodies or not

 From: https://github.com/liabru/matter-js/issues/179

 "Internally the engine uses MKS (meters, kilograms, and seconds) units 
 and radians for angles.

 If you use the built in renderer and and built in runner, with default 
 settings this translates to:
 
     1 position = 1 px
     1 speed = 1 px per step
     1 step = 16.666ms"

name: constructor
description:
Constructor for PsyanimEntity objects.

To create entities in your app, use the PsyanimScene::addEntity() method.

This is usually only called by the PsyanimScene.

params.name: scene
params.description: scene this entity belongs to.

params.name: name
params.description: entity name, must be unique per scene!

params.name: x
params.description: x-coordinate of entity's initial position in the world

params.name: y
params.description: y-coordinate of entity's initial position in the world

params.name: shapeParams
params.description: object defines entity shape & color

params.name: matterOptions
params.description: object defines physics properties of entity for matter-js

name: shapeParams
description: Parameters defining the shape of the entity.

properties.name: isEmpty
properties.description: If `true`, this entity will not have a visual representation or physics applied.

properties.name: shapeType
properties.description: can be a circle, rectangle, or triangle

properties.name: radius
properties.description: If `shapeType` is `PsyanimConstants.SHAPE_TYPE.CIRCLE`, `radius` parameter controls its size.

properties.name: width
properties.description: If `shapeType` is `PsyanimConstants.SHAPE_TYPE.RECTANGLE`, `width` and `height` parameters control its size.

properties.name: height
properties.description: If `shapeType` is `PsyanimConstants.SHAPE_TYPE.RECTANGLE`, `width` and `height` parameters control its size.

properties.name: base
properties.description: If `shapeType` is `PsyanimConstants.SHAPE_TYPE.TRIANGLE`, `base` and `altitude` parameters control its size.

properties.name: altitude
properties.description: If `shapeType` is `PsyanimConstants.SHAPE_TYPE.TRIANGLE`, `base` and `altitude` parameters control its size.

properties.name: color
properties.description: integer representing RGB color

properties.name: visible
properties.description: `true` if entity is visible

name: matterOptions
description: Parameters defining the physics settings of the entity.

properties.name: isSensor
properties.description: If true, entity will be able to emit collision events, but will not be receive physics updates

properties.name: isSleeping
properties.description: If true, entity will not have physics updates or receive collision events

properties.name: collisionFilter
properties.description: matter-js collision filter

name: shapeType
description: Entity shape type (defined in PsyanimConstants)

name: color
description: Entity color

name: color
description: Set's entity's color

params.description: RGB color value

name: initialPosition
description: Entity's initial position, supplied on construction

properties.description: x
y

name: enableFriction
description: Enabled friction on entity in physics simulation

name: disableFriction
description: Disables friction on entity in physics simulation

name: addComponent
description: Attaches a newly created instance of `componentType` to this entity.

params.name: componentType
params.description: the type of the component that should be added to this entity

return.description: reference to newly added PsyanimComponent

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - `true` if this entity has at least 1 component attached of type `componentType`

return.description: `true` if this entity has at least 1 component attached of type `componentType`

name: getComponent
description: Get an attached component instance on this entity by type.

name: getComponentByIndex
description:
Get an attached component instance on this entity by index.

Component indices are based on the order they were added using `AddComponent`

unknown.tagValue: {PsyanimComponent} - reference to attached component instance at `index`

return.description: reference to attached component instance at `index`

name: getComponents
description: Gets a shallow copy of PsyanimComponents attached to this entity

name: setPhysicsEnabled
description: Enables / disables the physics simulation for this entity

unknown.tagValue: An array of distances for each screen boundary as [left, right, top, bottom]

return.description: An array of distances for each screen boundary as [left, right, top, bottom]

name: destroy
description:
Destroys this entity, cleaning up all of its resources.

NOTE: When overriding this in a derived class, the base class destroy() should be called last.

name: position
description: This entity's position in the scene.

name: position
description: Sets this entity's position in the scene.

params.description: vector of the form: { x, y }

name: x
description: The x-coordinate of this entity's position in the scene.

name: y
description: The y-coordinate of this entity's position in the scene.

name: forward
description: A unit vector oriented in the direction this entity is facing.

name: right
description: A unit vector oriented to the right of this entity's forward direction.

name: velocity
description: The velocity vector of this entity.

name: constructor
description:
All prefabs must be constructed before they can be instantiated in the PsyanimScene.

A single prefab object may be instantiated in the scene multiple times.

During construction, `shapeParams` and `matterOptions` for the entity may optionally be supplied.

name: create
description: This `create()` method is intended to be overriden by the child class.

unknown.tagValue: {PsyanimEntity} - the entity this prefab used during instantiation

params.name: entity
params.description: the entity this prefab will work on during instantiation

return.description: the entity this prefab used during instantiation

name: src/core/PsyanimScene.js
PsyanimScene
description:
In Psyanim 2.0, everything that is seen in the world lives in a `PsyanimScene`, which is an abstraction for the 2D world we are simulating.

 A `PsyanimScene` IS a `Phaser.Scene`, and inherits all of its properties and methods.

 The `PsyanimScene` acts as a container for PsyanimEntity objects.

name: deleteTexturesOnShutdown
description: If set to `true`, all textures in texture manager will be deleted when this scene shuts down.

name: screenBoundary
description: A reference to the `PsyanimScreenBoundary` used by this scene.

name: addEntity
description: This method adds a new `PsyanimEntity` to the scene.

params.name: name
params.description: entity name, must be unique per scene!

params.name: x
params.description: x-coordinate of entity's initial position in the world

params.name: y
params.description: y-coordinate of entity's initial position in the world

params.name: shapeParams
params.description: object defines entity shape & color

params.name: matterOptions
params.description: object defines physics properties of entity for matter-js

return.description: reference to newly created entity

name: instantiatePrefab
description: This method adds a new 'PsyanimEntity' to the scene, using the `PsyanimEntityPrefab` to construct it.

params.name: prefab
params.description: instance of prefab that entity will be constructed from

params.name: instanceName
params.description: must be unique per scene!

params.name: x
params.description: x-coordinate of entity's initial position in scene

params.name: y
params.description: y-coordinate of entity's initial position in scene

return.description: reference to newly created entity

name: getAllEntityNames
description: Get a list of all entity names in this scene.

name: getEntityByName
description: Get a reference to an entity in this scene by name.

name: destroyEntityByName
description: Removes entity from this scene by name and destroys it.

name: getComponentByType
description: Searches all entities in this scene for `componentType` and returns a reference to the first component found.

unknown.tagValue: {PsyanimComponent} the first component found of type 'componentType'

return.description: the first component found of type 'componentType'

name: getComponentsByType
description: Searches all entities in this scene for `componentType` and returns a list of all components found.

name: init
description: The base `init()` method for all classes inheriting from `PsyanimScene`.

name: preload
description: The base `preload()` method for all classes inheriting from `PsyanimScene`.

name: create
description:
The base `create()` method for all classes inheriting from 'PsyanimScene'.

 `create()` is called once everytime a scene is loaded.

name: afterCreate
description:
The base `afterCreate()` method for all classes inheriting from `PsyanimScene.`

 `afterCreate()` is called once after every call to `create()`.

name: deleteAllTextures
description:
Calling this method will delete all textures in a scene.

 WARNING: make sure you have deleted any entities that might reference these textures before deleting them!

name: beforeShutdown
description:
The base `beforeShutdown()` method for all classes inheriting from `PsyanimScene.`

 `beforeShutdown()` is called once before this scene is shutdown (usually before loading another scene).

name: update
description:
This is the main real-time update() loop for the entire `PsyanimScene`.

All entities & their components are updated in this loop.

params.name: t
params.description: The current simulation time in seconds

params.name: dt
params.description: The delta time in ms since the last frame. This is a smoothed and capped value based on the FPS rate.

return.description: if true, characters crossing the screen boundary will be wrapped around to the other side, as if the world is spherical.

params.description: if true, characters crossing the screen boundary will be wrapped around to the other side, as if the world is spherical.

return.description: an array of entities this screen boundary is composed of: top, bottom, left, and right boundaries, respectively

_PsyanimJsPsychPlugin
description:
_PsyanimJsPsychPlugin is a private singleton instance that maintains state across all trials
 and handles all communication with PsyanimApp.

name: beginNextTrial
description: Called by jsPsych at the beginning of every trial

name: _trialParameters
description: compute agent names who have trial parameters for this._currentTrial

name: _agentsToRecord
description:
compute agents + names to record, considering those who have trial parameters,
 instanced entities, entities specified using wildcards...

name: endTrial
description: Called by jsPsych at the end of every trial

name: _replaceInstancedEntityNames
description:
Helper methods for computing '_agentNamesToRecord' and '_agentsToRecord' because they now depend on:

     - what the user specifies in the trial's 'agentNamesToRecord' parameter
     - what parameters have been modified or specified explicitly to be saved
     - whether the user used a wildcard
     - how many entity 'instances' are configured

name: _handlePsyanimSceneCreated
description: Handlers for after trial has begun and PsyanimScene creation has completed

name: src/integrations/PsyanimJsPsychTrial.js
PsyanimJsPsychTrial
description:
PsyanimJsPsychTrial class provides an API for building up a trial object as required
by the PsyanimJsPsychPlugin, for ease-of-use and to serve as a form of documentation itself.

It is highly recommended to use this class to generate the jsPsych trial object for your scene, 
rather than building it up manually.

It is also recommmended that you construct a new PsyanimJsPsychTrial object for each trial
in your jsPsych experiment.

params.name: sceneDefinitionTemplate
params.description: the Psyanim scene definition which will be used as a template for this trial

params.name: sceneKey
params.description: if provided, the scene key used for this trial will be overriden with this field's value

name: jsPsychTrialDefinition
description: Returns the `jsPsych trial object` corresponding to this trial's configuration for your `jsPsych timeline`.

return.description: jsPsych trial object, to be added to jsPsych timeline

name: sceneKey
description: The scene key associated with this trial

name: duration
description: The `duration` parameter for a trial determines the maximum amount of time the trial should last.

return.description: trial duration parameter

name: duration
description: The `duration` parameter for a trial determines the maximum amount of time the trial should last.

params.description: trial duration parameter

content:
# Psyanim 2.0 - Introduction and Overview

Psyanim 2.0 is a tool for rapid design, prototyping and deployment of psychology research experiments involving 2D procedural animation.

For a quick intro to Psyanim 2.0, check out our [docs](https://thefinnlab.github.io/psyanim-docs)!

Psyanim 2.0 depends on [`psyanim-utils`](https://github.com/thefinnlab/psyanim-utils), which is a small collection of javascript APIs that can be used in *both* browsers and nodejs apps.

To run the test suite:

- Run `npm i` from project root
- Start a watch service in a separate terminal with `npm run dev-watch`
- Start a local server to host the test suite with `npm run dev-serve`
- Navigate to `localhost:3000` in your web browser. Controls are at bottom of page.

To view the API docs from this repo:

- First build the docs with: `npm run docs-build`
- Then start a server to host the docs locally on port `5000` with: `npm run docs-serve`
- Then navigate to `localhost:5000` in your web browser

*NOTE: if you don't want to package source code with docs, simply delete the './file/' directory in the 'docs/' dir before deploying. Docs will work, but source links will simply give 404 error.*
name: ./README.md

{
  "name": "psyanim2",
  "type": "module",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "",
  "private": true,
  "files": [
    "./src/**/*.js",
    "./src/**/*.mjs"
  ],
  "main": "./src/index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "jasmine --config=src/test/unit/jasmine.json",
    "dev-build": "webpack --config ./webpack.dev.config.js",
    "dev-watch": "webpack --config ./webpack.dev.config.js --watch",
    "docs-build": "npx esdoc",
    "docs-serve": "npx http-server ./docs -p 5000",
    "dev-serve": "npx http-server ./dist -p 3000",
    "clean": "rimraf -v ./dist"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "",
  "license": "ISC",
  "dependencies": {
    "@jspsych/plugin-html-keyboard-response": "^1.1.2",
    "@jspsych/plugin-image-keyboard-response": "^1.1.2",
    "@jspsych/plugin-preload": "^1.1.2",
    "firebase": "^9.22.2",
    "html-webpack-plugin": "^5.5.0",
    "jspsych": "^7.3.3",
    "minimist": "^1.2.8",
    "nodemon": "^2.0.22",
    "pathfinding": "^0.4.18",
    "phaser": "^3.60.0",
    "psyanim-utils": "github:thefinnlab/psyanim-utils",
    "rimraf": "^5.0.1",
    "seedrandom": "^3.0.5",
    "uuid": "^9.0.0",
    "webpack": "^5.79.0",
    "webpack-cli": "^5.0.1",
    "ws": "^8.13.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "copy-webpack-plugin": "^11.0.0",
    "css-loader": "^6.8.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "file-loader": "^6.2.0",
    "http-server": "^14.1.1",
    "jasmine": "^5.0.1",
    "less-loader": "^11.1.3",
    "style-loader": "^3.3.3"
  }
}
